column5: Absolutely incredible Dara   :worthy: Awesome work!!!  I want to see more  How long did that take you to make from start to finish?? I can see in the background that you have a good supply of wood Leechman
Very nice work Dara. The clock is a beauty!!  S.

Thanks Leechman..not real sure how long. There is probably about 40 or 50 hours of work in it. it was a tough one. I generally have a few projects on the go so if I am stalled on one, I can move to another. That was likely in the shop for 3 or 4 months. I get a few hours a night at it, the odd day on a weekend. I have one more wall of wood like that one, and about 300 bd ft of oak sitting outside that has to be moved in soon. I collect wood like you guys collect lures
This one is my favourite so far. Awesome!! Jim

I kind of figured that it took that long of a time, so much details in the piece..... INCREDIBLY BEAUTIFUL Again great work and hoping to see more cause that's the kind of work I like to see..... may be a little video on how to.... from start to finish in the future would be awesome!!!  Thanks again Dara and keep up the great work Jacques

Sofa table...I made the whole set. Coffee table, end tables and sofa table. The wife tossed out the store bought stuff when I brought these in.     all mortice and tennon joints chopped with a hammer and chisel and a hand saw
Wow, now I'm truly impressed. Beautiful work, amazing talent and a great eye for detail.
I would of tossed it out too Dara     Like Spiel said.... now I'm truly impressed also!!! Jacques
awesome work pat yourself on the back
are you taking custom orders?  fine eye you have..  I really like the birch patterns most.
Amazing work! Very impressive! Might have to contact you one day for some custom stuff!!! Cheers, Dave
I need help designing a really sharp rod holder. Something the wife would let you display your G Loomis or St Croix's in the living room on..or at least the home office/den

Hey Dara, a friend of mine has a real nice rod "case" I guess you could say.  Same design as a gun cabniet, except wood with a glass door.  The top part has a shelf with a light where he puts the reels.  Looks really sharp.
A couple of people here have asked to see some of my shop work, so, here we go.  A set of tables recently shown in another thread and now finished.

Since the pics are posting this time...they don't always. Here is my latest.  The top is flame birch and the frame is cherry.  early stages..first dry fit     then after a bunch of tapering, beveling, planing and first coat of tung oil.
Nice work Dara! That top would make a very nice guitar! FLamed maple mmmmmmm..... HH
Those are beautiful Dara, definitely something to be proud of.
Nice work, wish I had the patience.
Dara,  that new table would look really nice in my living room-- are you selling that?  PM me with a price.
Very nice work Dara !!
Some gorgeous work there Dara!!! IF you don' t mind I stole the pictures for my daughter to add to her collection of "art" to build.
Just super, Dara!  I love that stuff! Very nice work.
Nice job, I enjoy woodworking myself just tough to find the time.  Winter is coming and there is plenty of wood in the garage by the stove, still dreaming up this years project

Thanks for the nice comments guys. Monsterman, PM sent. Yes, its spoken for..housewarming gift for a friend of the wife. There is more to come though...kids are grown and I get lots of shop time.  Thats fine irishfield..makes me proud...but you can't build this art..it grows
LOL.. she's always looking for something new to build. Lost a 1/5th of my shop to her. This was her first big project.. when she was 16/17    ..and some of her other projects..
Looks great---you can really appreciate fine woodworking  Bushart
Like I said before Dara, you should post more pics of your "hobby". Maybe add some of your earlier stuff that I and others have seen before.

Love it Dara.... Awesome job man!!! Beautiful craftsmanship Take a bow sir..... you deserve it Like Tom said, please post your previous projects.... would like to see them!!! Thanks for sharing Leechman
Very nice !!! true craftsmanship...love the marbling of the top ..it shows very well...  can you make my garage look as good as your shop??? PLEASE!

Awesome! beautiful work.  I love the design of the table, is its your own?   great looking top!  I'm a finish carpenter and have a nice little shop I just dont use all that much,  but your pics are very motivating  thanks for the post!   Ryan

I'm impressed Irishfield (for some reason I can't recall your name) your daughter does really nice work, and for 16...wow. Thanks for the comments guys..I will put a few more pictures up. I have always loved woodworking but just the last few years gotten the time and tools to really pursue it. Woodworking sites can be great teachers and motivators.    a cremation urn I did a few weeks ago. The name , dates and a maple leaf were laser engraved on it later
A little cabinet in Walnut..It stands about lower chest height.
Clock/curio cabinet

I won three Local Skill comps here in Burlington in wood working went to the worlds in 2006 came in 2nd. I have always had a passion for wood working! After High school I just went into carpentry and never went back. Sold all my projects I made in school.   Funny everyone in class amde 3 projects each term while i doubled that.  Yes I was one of those kids who left class just to goto shop class and work. hehe
Some fine craftmanship right there..

The book keeper at work wanted a table for his home office. I had done one with a lower shelf. he said he wanted another shelf so he could put family pictures on it. I thought a second shelf would look like a book case rather than a table, so i chopped the shelf so he could arrange different size pictures on it. Maple painted black and  Jatoba (aka brazillian cherry by yhe marketers) with tung oil varnish.     and a couple of tiger maple and jatoba tables.     thats it for now..thanks again guys..yes, most are my own designs...not the clock though..that came from a book
I'm impressed...there is nothing here to enter. Hopefully you get back into it someday
